title: Human Factors in Safety Case Submissions
content: Safety cases must demonstrate systematic HF consideration across 14 topic areas: HF in design, managing human performance, organizational integrity, and HF in SEMS. Each topic requires evidence proportionate to MAH risk. For heritage rigs, demonstrate what's been done and justify where full compliance is impractical. New builds must meet current standards.

mcq.question: A 20-year-old rig operates in the UKCS. Control room layout doesn't meet ISO 11064. What should the safety case demonstrate?

options.A: Nothingâ€”it's a heritage asset, standards don't apply
options.B: Why full compliance is impractical and what alternative measures are in place
options.C: Plan to retrofit to full compliance immediately
options.D: That the rig operates safely despite non-compliance

mcq.explanation: Safety cases for heritage assets should explain why full compliance is impractical (cost, lifecycle) and demonstrate alternative risk controls that achieve ALARP.

openQuestions: Which of the 14 HF topics are strongest in your safety case? Which are weakest?
For older rigs, how do you justify deviations from current HF standards?
